name: Engage Consult
bio: Engage Consult allows patients and carers to connect with their GP practice and access services online from a PC, tablet or smartphone.

name: Corona-Help.UK
bio: Corona-Help.UK is a website based, anonymous chatbot. It asks you questions about your experience with coronavirus (COVID-19), including if you:

name: Digital Health Passport
bio:
The Digital Health Passport app is designed to help young
people with asthma take control of their condition. You can use it to create
asthma action plans, track symptoms and access NHS support.

name: distrACT
bio:
The distrACT app gives you easy, quick and discreet access
to information and advice about

name: Chill Panda
bio: Learn to relax, manage your worries and improve your wellbeing with Chill Panda. The app measures your heart rate and suggests tasks to suit your state of mind. Tasks include simple breathing techniques and light exercises to take your mind off your worries.

name: Echo Pharmacy
bio:
Echo is the
free online repeat prescription service by Lloyds Pharmacy. Echo works with GP surgeries
in England to take care of prescriptions. You can request your medicines and
Echo will confirm and dispense them to a delivery address of your choice.

name: Cove
bio: Create music to capture your mood and express how you feel with the Cove app. Instead of words, create music to reflect emotions like joy, sadness, calm and anger. You can store your music in a personal journal, or send them to someone and let the music do the talking.

name: Co-op Health
bio:
You can
order your repeat prescription from Co-op Health (formally Dimec), and choose how and where you
get your medication.

name: ChatHealth
bio: ChatHealth is a secure and confidential text messaging service for young people. It allows patients to easily and anonymously get in touch with a healthcare professional for advice and support.

name: Changing Health
bio: Lose weight, eat better and move more with the Changing Health app, a lifestyle coaching programme for people with

name: Catch It
bio: Learn how to manage feelings like

name: Becca Breast Cancer Support App
bio:
Breast Cancer Now's
Becca app provides specialist support to help you live with, through and beyond

name: BlueIce
bio: BlueIce is an evidenced-based app to help young people manage their emotions and reduce urges to

name: Brush DJ
bio: Brush DJ plays two minutes of your music so you brush your teeth for the right amount of time. The app has short videos on how to brush your teeth and how to clean in between them using an interdental brush or floss.

name: Calm Harm
bio: Calm Harm is an app designed to help people resist or manage the urge to self-harm. It's private and password protected.

name: Beat Panic
bio: Beat Panic is designed to guide people through a panic attack or raised anxiety using their phone.

name: Be Mindful
bio:
Be Mindful is an online course for reducing stress,
depression and anxiety. It guides you through the elements of mindfulness-based
cognitive therapy (MBCT).

name: Baby Buddy
bio:
The Baby Buddy app guides you through your pregnancy and the
first 6 months following your baby's birth. It is designed to help you look
after your baby's mental and physical health, as well as your own, and give
your baby the best start in life.

name: Baby and Child First Aid
bio: The British Red Cross Baby and Child First Aid app provides simple, easy-to-learn skills to help a baby or child in a first aid emergency.

name: ACR Digital Urinalysis
bio: The ACR Digital Urinalysis app enables you to test the concentrations of albumin (a protein in the blood) and creatinine (a waste product) in a sample of your pee.

name: Healthera
bio: The Healthera app helps you get the most out of your local pharmacy services. You can use it to manage your repeat prescriptions and medication, book appointments and contact your pharmacist for clinical advice.

name: HealthUnlocked
bio: Find and connect with people with a similar health condition using HealthUnlocked. The service has over 700 online communities focused on health and wellbeing topics including cancer, thyroid disease, running and weight loss. With more than 4 million monthly users, there is a community for you.

name: Hospify
bio: Hospify has been designed so that healthcare professionals can keep in touch with each other, as well as with patients.

name: Feeling Good: positive mindset
bio: Relax your body and mind with a series of audio tracks designed to help you build confidence, energy and a positive mindset.

name: Healthcare Anywhere
bio: The Healthcare Anywhere app aims to help you take control of your health. It works with your healthcare team so you can get expert support and advice when and where you need it.

name: GDm-Health
bio:
The GDm-Health app is part of a system that helps clinicians
manage diabetes in pregnancy.

name: First Aid by British Red Cross
bio: The free First Aid app features simple, easy-to-learn skills for a range of first aid situations.

name: Family Assist
bio: Family Assist provides a wide range of information and resources on pregnancy and the early stages of your child's life. It acts as a library that stores all relevant information about your pregnancy in one place that can be accessed from your mobile phone, tablet or PC.

name: EXi
bio: The EXi app creates a 12-week exercise plan based on health information entered by the user. It then sets the duration and intensity of the exercise based on this information.

name: Evergreen Life
bio: Evergreen Life is a personal health record app that stores your health information in one place. You can also create an account on the

name: engage warfarin self-care
bio: Patients receiving treatment to prevent blood clots can use the engage self-care app to self-test safely and conveniently. Using the engage app can reduce the need for regular clinic visits by monitoring your INR (International Normalised Ratio) at home, at work or while abroad, and make the results available to your care team immediately.

name: eQuoo: Emotional Fitness Game
bio:
The eQuoo app uses adventure games designed by psychologists
to help you increase your emotional fitness and teach you new psychological
skills.

name: LymEx
bio: The LymEx app aims to support those with lymphoedema. It was created by someone with lymphoedema to help others with the condition.

name: Low Carb Program
bio: The Low Carb Program can help anyone with

name: Living With
bio: The Living With app lets you keep in touch with your clinical team and helps you manage your health condition.

name: Kicks Count
bio: Use the Kicks Count app to keep track of your baby's movements in the womb and look out for any changes.

name: Liva UK
bio: The Liva app is a digital platform to help you manage conditions such as diabetes, heart problems and obesity, and make changes to your lifestyle. Using patient self-monitoring and expert guidance from a dedicated coach, Liva lets you closely monitor your health and provides trusted support along the way.

name: Howz
bio: Howz is a smart home system that helps older people stay independent for longer. The Howz app lets you check that an older person is OK without being intrusive.

name: ieso
bio: ieso is an online course using instant messaging for people with mental health problems. The confidential service puts you in touch with a therapist trained in cognitive behavioural therapy. The therapy is by text so you can review your sessions at any time.

name: Integrated Family Delivered Neonatal Care (IFDC)
bio: The IFDC app helps parents of premature babies take an active role in their newborn's treatment in an intensive care unit.

name: Mumoactive
bio: Mumoactive makes tracking your type 1 diabetes quick and easy so you can get on with your life. Add your values, such as blood sugar, by moving your finger up and down a wheel on your device's touchscreen.

name: Miiskin
bio: Miiskin helps you track any changes in your skin and moles. Take photos over time and compare them side by side to spot any changes.

name: mapmydiabetes
bio: Mapmydiabetes is an online programme of information, guidance and self-help tools to support people in the management of their type 2 diabetes.

name: Medloop
bio:
The Medloop app lets you
book GP appointments, order repeat prescriptions, message your GP surgery, and look at your medical records and test results.

name: MoleCare
bio: MoleCare is designed to help you look after your skin. You can use it to check and compare your moles and assess the health of your skin.

name: MUTU System Programme
bio: MUTU System is an evidence-based online exercise programme to help women strengthen their core and pelvic floor muscles after giving birth.

name: mySugr
bio: The mySugr diabetes app is a digital logbook that can help make your life with diabetes easier.

name: MeeTwo
bio:
The MeeTwo app provides a safe and secure forum for
teenagers wanting to discuss any issue affecting their lives.

name: MyDesmond
bio: MyDesmond is an online self-management diabetes education programme.

name: myGP
bio:
The myGP app lets you book GP appointments, order repeat
prescriptions and set up medication reminders on your smartphone.

name: MyCognition Home
bio: MyCognition Home is a brain training app for the entire family to help them think faster, focus better, and improve decision-making and memory.

name: MyChoicePad
bio: MyChoicePad helps people with learning disabilities communicate better. The iPad app has over 4,000 symbols and signs from the Makaton language. Use the app to build vocabulary and communicate feelings, choices and needs.

name: My Possible Self: The Mental Health App
bio:
Take control of your thoughts, feelings and behaviour with
the My Possible Self mental health app. Use the simple learning modules to
manage fear, anxiety and stress and tackle unhelpful thinking. Record your experiences
and track symptoms to better understand your mental health.

name: my mhealth: myHeart
bio:
myHeart helps you understand
your

name: my mhealth: myDiabetes
bio:
myDiabetes helps you better
manage

name: my mhealth: myAsthma
bio:
myAsthma helps you better manage your condition, perfect your inhaler technique,
understand your treatment, and track your medication and wellbeing.

name: my mhealth: myCOPD
bio: myCOPD helps people with COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease) to better manage their condition. Use it to perfect your inhaler technique, improve your breathing, reduce exacerbations, track your medication and more.

name: My Diabetes My Way
bio: My Diabetes My Way is an interactive website and smartphone app for people with diabetes and their family, friends and carers. It provides reliable and accurate information and resources to help you manage your condition more effectively.

name: My House of Memories
bio:
The My House of Memories app lets you explore objects from
the past and share memories together.

name: My Health Guide
bio: My Health Guide is an easy-to-use communication tool for adults with learning disabilities. You can use the app to give carers and medical staff a better understanding of your health needs. Information such as healthcare, diet and feelings can be added as text, photos, videos and audio.

name: OneTouch Reveal
bio: Free

name: NHS Pulse
bio: NHS Pulse is an online survey for NHS employees. It gives staff the chance to have a say on issues such as the level of support they're receiving at work during the COVID-19 pandemic.

name: nujjer
bio: nujjer is a wristband tracker and linked app that aims to help you understand and change your habits to improve your lifestyle and prevent type 2 diabetes.

name: NHS Online Bexley
bio: Consult your GP online, book an appointment, order a prescription and much more using the NHS Online Bexley app.

name: NHS Go
bio: The NHS Go app provides young people with confidential health advice and greater access to health information. You can find local services in some areas and learn about health and your rights as a user of the NHS.

name: NHS COVID-19
bio: Protect your loved ones with the official NHS COVID-19 contact tracing app for England and Wales.

name: SOS QR
bio:
With SOS QR you can be better prepared, call for help and
send your location in an emergency.

name: Sleepio
bio: Sleepio is an online sleep improvement programme for people living in Oxfordshire, Berkshire and Buckinghamshire. It has been clinically proven to help you fall asleep faster, stay asleep through the night, and give you more energy during the day if you follow the programme correctly.

name: Sleepstation
bio: Sleepstation is a 6-week online course for people who struggle to fall asleep or stay asleep through the night. The course is tailored to your needs, using the information you provide, and gives you access to a team of sleep experts who will offer helpful advice and support throughout.

name: SilverCloud
bio: SilverCloud is for people aged 16 or over who need help with mental health issues and the emotional challenges associated with long-term conditions.

name: Second Nature
bio: The Second Nature app lets you set your own targets to change your behaviour and achieve a healthier lifestyle. Your online health coach and support group will help you to eat well, be more active and stay motivated.

name: Rafi-Tone
bio: The Rafi-Tone app is designed to make using an inhaler with a spacer easier and more fun for young children with wheeze or asthma symptoms. With guidance from Rafi Robot, the app's star, your child can improve their breathing technique.

name: Pzizz
bio: The Pzizz app helps you quickly calm your mind, fall asleep fast, stay asleep, and wake up refreshed.

name: Peanut
bio: The Peanut app aims to make sure no one has to navigate womanhood alone, especially the hard parts.

name: Patients Know Best
bio: Patients Know Best works with the NHS to give patients instant access to their medical records. You can access up-to-date information on treatments, medication, allergies and more from any device. This information can be shared with different medical teams and carers to speed up and improve your treatment.

name: Pathway through Pain
bio: Pathway through Pain is an online course to help you manage chronic musculoskeletal pain.

name: OWise breast cancer
bio: Use the OWise breast cancer app to keep track of your treatment and your wellbeing. Record fatigue, appetite, pain and other health facts to spot trends and help improve your care. You can also record conversations with your doctor to listen back to in your own time.

name: Pando
bio: The Pando app is a secure communication and collaboration tool. It has been designed to help anyone working in health and social care.

name: Oviva
bio: The Oviva app connects you with a specialist coach to help you achieve your personal lifestyle goals, such as weight loss, feeling healthier, and managing your diabetes.

name: vCreate
bio:
vCreate is a secure video messaging service that lets unit
staff record and send secure video updates to parents when
they’re unable to be by their child’s side. There is no cost to parents or the
unit as vCreate work with hospital charities to secure sponsorship from local businesses.

name: NHS App
bio: Find out more about the

name: Untire: Beating cancer fatigue
bio:
The Untire self-help app provides a step-by-step guide to help you and your family and friends beat cancer-related fatigue (CRF). Whether you're a cancer patient or survivor, the programme can help
you regain energy.

name: Togetherall
bio: Togetherall is an online community for people who are

name: Thrive
bio: Thrive helps you prevent and manage stress, anxiety and related conditions. The game based app can be used to relax before a stressful situation or on a more regular basis to help you live a happier, more stress-free life.

name: Yellow Card
bio: The Yellow Card app lets you report suspected side effects for medicines and vaccines to the UK Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA).

name: ThinkNinja
bio: ThinkNinja is a mental health app designed for 10 to 18 year olds. Using a variety of content and tools, it allows young people to learn about mental health and emotional wellbeing, and develop skills they can use to build resilience and stay well.

name: Wholesome World
bio: The Wholesome World app has a collection of recipes, nutritional information and medical and lifestyle resources that focus on health and wellbeing.

name: WorryTree
bio: Free

name: WaitLess
bio:
The WaitLess app helps you find the quickest access to the
best care in east Kent, Dorset and Northampton.

name: Sugarmedown
bio:
The Sugarmedown app lets you monitor how much added sugar
you eat. The 12-week programme offers food plans and workouts to help you lose
weight and avoid developing conditions such as

name: Talk Around It Home
bio:
Talk Around It Home is a speech and language therapy app for
anyone with word finding difficulties. It
can be used to treat conditions such as aphasia, anomia, stroke, dementia, Alzheimer's
and autism.

name: Student Health App
bio: The Student Health App provides easy access to more than 900 pages of reliable health information all in one place. The content has been created for university students by NHS doctors and is regularly updated.

name: Squeezy for men
bio: Squeezy helps men to remember to do their pelvic floor muscle (kegel) exercises and to do them in the right way.

name: Squeezy CF
bio: Squeezy helps men and women with cystic fibrosis (CF) remember to do their pelvic floor exercises and to do them in the right way. The app is endorsed by the CF Trust.

name: Stress & Anxiety Companion
bio: Stress & Anxiety Companion helps you handle stress and anxiety on-the-go. Using breathing exercises, relaxing music and games designed to calm the mind, the app helps you change negative thoughts to help you better cope with life's ups and downs.

name: Squeezy
bio: Squeezy helps women to remember to do their pelvic floor muscle (kegel) exercises and to do them in the right way.

name: SpineWise
bio:
SpineWise is a desk exercise app designed by an NHS Spinal Specialist
Physiotherapist, to help prevent and treat
